explains: adj. 令人吃惊的，不寻常的；极鲜亮的
v. 使吓一跳，使惊奇（startle 的现在分词）

sentences.en: Sometimes the results may be rather startling.
sentences.cn: 有时结果可能相当惊人。

sentences.en: These myths have a startling likeness to one another.
sentences.cn: 这些神话彼此有惊人的相似之处。

sentences.en: Dekkeret found the landscape startling in its ugliness.
sentences.cn: 德克雷特发现那风景难看得令人吃惊。
